document_data.name: Nobles' Quarter
document_data.mainbody: The '''Nobles' Quarter''', previously known as the '''Mansion District''' of [[Phlan]],{{Cite dungeon/170/Monument of the Ancients|55}} It was home to Phlan's wealthiest and most influential citizens and noble families.
document_data.Description:
The homes found in the Nobles' Quarter were grand structures that were given ample surrounding room.

As befitting its affluent residents, the district was far better kept that the rest of the city. Its cobblestone streets were kept clean from dirt and clutter for the city's distinguished nobles.
document_data.Geography: The Nobles' Quarter remained a part of Phlan's [[Phlan/Old City|Old City]], while being the only district that lay on the eastern bank of the Stojanow. It was the Nobles' Quarter around which the region of [[Phlan/East Phlan|East Phlan]] was built.{{Cite dungeon/170/Monument of the Ancients|53}}
document_data.Defenses: As part of the Old City the Nobles' Quarter was granted great protection from Phlan's massive city walls.{{Cite dungeon/170/Monument of the Ancients|52}}
document_data.History: Following the [[Dragon Run]] that devastated Phlan in the {{YearlinkName|1306}}, the Mansion District (as it was then called) was considered part of the ruined region known as [[Phlan/Old Phlan|Old Phlan]]. The district was plundered and stripped of much of its valuables and trappings of wealth. Bands of [[hobgoblin]]s and [[Bane]]-worshiping [[orc]]s occupied the district's streets, spreading filth and threatening [[adventurer]]s that sought to reclaim the richest area of Phlan.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: ''Circa'' the late 1350s DR, it was said that the estates of the district held some of Phlan's greatest caches of treasure.
document_data.Notable Locations:
* [[Lyceum of the Black Lord]], Phlan's resident temple of Bane.
* [[Kovel Mansion]], the most luxurious and most renowned of Phlan's noble estates.
